catalog_info.title: Acoustics of Speech and Hearing
catalog_info.notes: This course is taught in consort with 6.551J/HST.714J at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Classes will be held at MIT.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Mathematical methods in science (Applied Mathematics 21a or Mathematics 21a) or equivalent. Rigid body mechanics (Physics 11A), or electrical circuits (Engineering Science 154) or permission of the instructor.
catalog_info.description: Discusses limitations that the speech production and hearing systems impose on the sounds we produce and sense. Focuses on acoustic cues used in sound localization, speech production mechanisms, the mechanics of sound reception and perception.
